title: Z390
author: Z390
content: What particular algorithm the RTX 4*** series are good for? The RTX 30** are good for Ergo dual mining but I know that they aren't profitable anymore, now that Ethereum stops proof of work.RYO and Conceal ( cryptonightGPU ) ? Or KHeavyHash

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Ethereum mining has not been relevant since September of this year. Mining on new video cards will pay off the equipment for a very long time, so now there is no perfect coin. The most profitable coins change every week.https://whattomine.com/gpus?cost=0.05&cost_currency=USD&button=&nvidia=true&amd=true&filter=all&sort=I wouldn't mine these GPUs right now to keep them in good condition.

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Quote from: Z390 on December 07, 2022, 05:17:54 PMWhat particular algorithm the RTX 4*** series are good for? The RTX 30** are good for Ergo dual mining but I know that they aren't profitable anymore, now that Ethereum stops proof of work.RYO and Conceal ( cryptonightGPU ) ? Or KHeavyHashEvery single coin is mining at a loss with the price of cryptocurrencies nowadays and the price of electricity in most of Europe skyrocket high,does not make sense to mine so the only possibility to start doing it is if you believe in a coin that you think will explode in the next bull run which everyone is predicting to be in the year 2025.It does not matter now whichever coin you mine,just mine what coin you think has a great developers team behind,a great roadmap and hope for the best,if you can't afford to mine for the long term then don't mine at all.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: According to the latest rumors, RTX 4060 Ti would get AD106-350 GPU with 4352 CUDA cores. This particular SKU would feature 8GB of GDDR6 memory clocked at 18 Gbps. This would be the first known model from RTX 40 series to feature GDDR6 memory instead of GDDR6X. Earlier leaks mentioned that AD106 features 128-bit memory bus, which means this card would have a bandwidth of 288 GB/s.https://videocardz.com/newz/nvidia-geforce-rtx-4060-ti-rumored-to-feature-4352-cudas-8gb-memory-and-220w-tdphttps://twitter.com/kopite7kimi/status/1602761028584247298?

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Quote from: FP91G on December 15, 2022, 10:22:41 AMAccording to the latest rumors, RTX 4060 Ti would get AD106-350 GPU with 4352 CUDA cores. This particular SKU would feature 8GB of GDDR6 memory clocked at 18 Gbps. This would be the first known model from RTX 40 series to feature GDDR6 memory instead of GDDR6X. Earlier leaks mentioned that AD106 features 128-bit memory bus, which means this card would have a bandwidth of 288 GB/s.https://videocardz.com/newz/nvidia-geforce-rtx-4060-ti-rumored-to-feature-4352-cudas-8gb-memory-and-220w-tdphttps://twitter.com/kopite7kimi/status/1602761028584247298?This means that this should be the best card to buy for mining as GDDR6 does not heat to much compared to GDDR6X which is well known to heat up early and bring up problems,we had a lot of cases that the hash rate was down in this very section because of the GDDR6X memory.I only hope that the price is good,and seeing 220w tdp I think that it should perform well at 80 Mhsh at 140 w tuned for Ethash algorithm,if the price is good a rig with 3 of such cards will consume not much but will be mining a good amount of crypto like ETHW which difficulty right now is in the lows.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: swogerino on December 16, 2022, 02:57:08 PMQuote from: FP91G on December 15, 2022, 10:22:41 AMAccording to the latest rumors, RTX 4060 Ti would get AD106-350 GPU with 4352 CUDA cores. This particular SKU would feature 8GB of GDDR6 memory clocked at 18 Gbps. This would be the first known model from RTX 40 series to feature GDDR6 memory instead of GDDR6X. Earlier leaks mentioned that AD106 features 128-bit memory bus, which means this card would have a bandwidth of 288 GB/s.https://videocardz.com/newz/nvidia-geforce-rtx-4060-ti-rumored-to-feature-4352-cudas-8gb-memory-and-220w-tdphttps://twitter.com/kopite7kimi/status/1602761028584247298?This means that this should be the best card to buy for mining as GDDR6 does not heat to much compared to GDDR6X which is well known to heat up early and bring up problems,we had a lot of cases that the hash rate was down in this very section because of the GDDR6X memory.I only hope that the price is good,and seeing 220w tdp I think that it should perform well at 80 Mhsh at 140 w tuned for Ethash algorithm,if the price is good a rig with 3 of such cards will consume not much but will be mining a good amount of crypto like ETHW which difficulty right now is in the lows.2 RX5600 video cards consume 160-170 watts and give out 80-85 megahash on the Ethash algorithm. The price of these graphics cards in good condition is now $200 each. If you need ETHW coins, then you can buy a similar hashrate cheaper and mine while the hashrate of the coin is small.

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Quote from: FP91G on December 17, 2022, 01:35:05 PMQuote from: swogerino on December 16, 2022, 02:57:08 PMQuote from: FP91G on December 15, 2022, 10:22:41 AMAccording to the latest rumors, RTX 4060 Ti would get AD106-350 GPU with 4352 CUDA cores. This particular SKU would feature 8GB of GDDR6 memory clocked at 18 Gbps. This would be the first known model from RTX 40 series to feature GDDR6 memory instead of GDDR6X. Earlier leaks mentioned that AD106 features 128-bit memory bus, which means this card would have a bandwidth of 288 GB/s.https://videocardz.com/newz/nvidia-geforce-rtx-4060-ti-rumored-to-feature-4352-cudas-8gb-memory-and-220w-tdphttps://twitter.com/kopite7kimi/status/1602761028584247298?This means that this should be the best card to buy for mining as GDDR6 does not heat to much compared to GDDR6X which is well known to heat up early and bring up problems,we had a lot of cases that the hash rate was down in this very section because of the GDDR6X memory.I only hope that the price is good,and seeing 220w tdp I think that it should perform well at 80 Mhsh at 140 w tuned for Ethash algorithm,if the price is good a rig with 3 of such cards will consume not much but will be mining a good amount of crypto like ETHW which difficulty right now is in the lows.2 RX5600 video cards consume 160-170 watts and give out 80-85 megahash on the Ethash algorithm. The price of these graphics cards in good condition is now $200 each. If you need ETHW coins, then you can buy a similar hashrate cheaper and mine while the hashrate of the coin is small.That is also a very good advice which I have not thought about but the problem is these cards are only 6 GB and as far as I know the ETHW dag file size is already at 5.2 GB or near it which means I doubt I can mine for that long with those cards and this is going to be the downside to this,probably they are good options for mining ETC while you wait for the price of ETC to grow.They can also be good cards to mine my ETHW at that power consumption is better than a RTX 3080 which does just a bit more than that and consume more power,maybe it is the right time to invest in such cards as 5 of those can give you 200 Mhsh at 400 watt in total and 500 watt in total together with the motherboard and with ETHW mining difficulty it can be a gamble worth taking.
